intro: Hieracium adesum, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant features bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, typically from July to September. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it often grows in meadows and grassy areas. Hieracium adesum is a perennial plant that can reach heights of up to 60 centimeters.
